citations.narrative:
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review at time of this inspection. There were no inventory
records kept since the first week of January 2024. A total of 122 adult guinea pigs, 131 weanlings, and 8 newborns were
counted during this inspection. Failure to maintain records can make it difficult to assess the health of the caviary by
identifying animal losses by decreased number of guinea pigs born and raised. Licensee must maintain records
containing the required information for animals which disclose the number of guinea pigs, owned, acquired, or disposed of
including births and deaths. Correct by March 14, 2024.

Space. There were four weanling enclosures with inadequate space. Enclosures measure 36 inches by 24 inches or 864
square inches of floor space. Guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams require at least 60 square inches of floor space per
animal. These weanling enclosures were noted to have 16, 18, 18 and 22 animals present. Can not house more than 14
weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams in this size enclosure.
Inadequate space can cause stress and increase aggression in animals which can lead to bites, scratches, ear chewing,
and other injuries and health problems. Licensee must ensure that guinea pigs are provided with at least the required
minimum amount of floor space per animal to prevent overcrowding, stress, and aggression. Correct by March 9, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
A current record of guinea pigs on hand was not available for review  at time of this inspection. There were no inventory 
records kept since the first week of January 2024. A total of 122 adult guinea pigs, 131 weanlings, and 8 newborns were 
counted during this inspection. Failure to maintain records can make it difficult to assess the health of the caviary by 
identifying animal losses by decreased number of guinea pigs born and raised. Licensee must maintain records 
containing the required information for animals which disclose the number of guinea pigs, owned, acquired, or disposed of 
including births and deaths. Correct by March 14, 2024. 
3.28(c)(1)(iii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Space. There were four weanling enclosures with inadequate space. Enclosures measure 36 inches by 24 inches or 864 
square inches of floor space. Guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams require at least 60 square inches of floor space per 
animal. These weanling enclosures were noted to have 16, 18, 18 and 22 animals present. Can not house more than 14 
weanling guinea pigs weighing up to 350 grams in this size enclosure.  
 
Inadequate space can cause stress and increase aggression in animals which can lead to bites, scratches, ear chewing, 
and other injuries and health problems. Licensee must ensure that guinea pigs are provided  with at least the required 
minimum amount of floor space per animal to prevent overcrowding,  stress, and aggression. Correct by March 9, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
